properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 8:47PM PST until January 21 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY
AFTERNOON...

.A cold front will bring widespread precipitation to northwest
California Monday night into Tuesday. Snow levels will fall from
5000 feet to 4000 feet during Tuesday. This will result in mostly
rain and wet road conditions across the passes of Highway 299,
and just minor accumulations, if any, along Highway 36. However,
up to a foot of snow will be possible at Scott Mountain Summit on
Highway 3.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4500 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as
high as 50 mph in exposed mountainous terrain.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County including Scott Mountain
Summit on Highway 3.

* WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Chain
requirements over Scott Mountain Summit and periods of road
closure are possible. Blowing and drifting snow could make
visibility poor.

* If you must travel, carry an emergency kit with tire chains,
flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications.

* Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm.

* The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4500 FEET
